#define GROUP_NUMBER   "01"

The group number used in the image identifier.

Function Documentation

void flushBuffer ( void   ) 

Flushes stdin to remove any leftover characters which may still be lying around.

int readChar ( char *  c  ) 

Wrapper around readValue to read a single character (and make sure no more than one character was passed).

Removes trailing spaces before and after the text.

Parameters:
c Pointer to store the character read.
Return values:
-1 Error.
0 Success.

int readData ( artwork_info *  info  ) 

Reads the input from the user with information about one artwork entry.

Parameters:
info Pointer to the place we want to store the data read.
Return values:
0 Success.
1 Error.

void readInt ( const char *  inputText,
char *  dest,
size_t  length 
)

Reads input and checks if it's a valid integer. If not, read it until a valid integer is entered.

Removes all trailing spaces before checking if the text is valid.

Parameters:
inputText The text to print before waiting for input.
dest Pointer to the place where we want to store the input.
length The maximum number of characters that can be stored.

void readString ( const char *  inputText,
char *  dest,
size_t  length 
)

Read input from the user until it is not null.

Removes all trailing whitespace before checking if the text is null.

Parameters:
inputText The text to print before waiting for input.
dest Pointer to the place where we want to store the input.
length The maximum number of characters that can be stored.

void readValue ( char  s[],
size_t  length 
)

Read at most length bytes frm stdin. Strip trailing whitespace and newline character if they're present.

If no newline is found, clear the input buffer before leaving.

Parameters:
s Where to store the input.
length The maximum number of characters that can be stored.

void stripNewLine ( char  s[]  ) 

Replaces the trailing '\n' character (if it exists) in a string with '\0'.

If a newline character is not found, it flushes the input buffer.

Parameters:
s The string which should be stripped.

void stripWhiteSpace ( char  str[]  ) 

Removes whitespace from the beginning and the end of the string, and also duplicate whitespace in the middle of the text.

Parameters:
str The string which should be stripped.
